text: The 2nd Army Corps () was a formation in the Imperial Russian Army that was active during World War I. It was headquartered in Grodno prior to the outbreak of the war, and took part in the Battle of Tannenberg in August 1914.2-й армейский корпус | 2nd Army Corps regiment.ru (In Russian) ==Composition== *26th Infantry Division *43rd Infantry Division *2nd Cavalry Division ==Commanders== *1907: Kyprian Kandratovich *1912-1914: Sergei Scheidemann * 08.06.1915 — 30.05.1917 : Vasily Flug == See also == *Imperial Russian Army formations and units (1914) == Notes == Category:Corps of the Russian Empire Category:Military units and formations established in 1877 Category:Military units and formations disestablished in 1917
title: 2nd Army Corps (Russian Empire)
